name: ext_R5_ImagingSelection
title: Cross-version Extension for R5.ImagingSelection for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents ImagingSelection from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ImagingSelection|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: A selection of DICOM SOP instances and/or frames
element.definition: A selection of DICOM SOP instances and/or frames within a single Study and Series. This might include additional specifics such as an image region, an Observation UID or a Segmentation Number, allowing linkage to an Observation Resource or transferring this information along with the ImagingStudy Resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Related resource that is the focus for the imaging selection
element.definition: The actual focus of an observation when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. For example, fetus observations in a mother's record.  The focus of an observation could also be an existing condition,  an intervention, the subject's diet,  another observation of the subject,  or a body structure such as tumor or implanted device.   An example use case would be using the Observation resource to capture whether the mother is trained to change her child's tracheostomy tube. In this example, the child is the patient of record and the mother is the focus.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. element.short: The selected subset of the SOP Instance
element.definition:
Selected subset of the SOP Instance. The content and format of the subset item is determined by the SOP Class of the selected instance.
       May be one of:
       - A list of frame numbers selected from a multiframe SOP Instance.
       - A list of Content Item Observation UID values selected from a DICOM SR or other structured document SOP Instance.
       - A list of segment numbers selected from a segmentation SOP Instance.
       - A list of Region of Interest (ROI) numbers selected from a radiotherapy structure set SOP Instance.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. element.short: A specific 2D region in a DICOM image / frame
element.definition:
Each imaging selection instance or frame list might includes an image region, specified by a region type and a set of 2D coordinates.
       If the parent imagingSelection.instance contains a subset element of type frame, the image region applies to all frames in the subset list.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Specifies the coordinates that define the image region
element.definition:
The coordinates describing the image region. Encoded as a set of (column, row) pairs that denote positions in the selected image / frames specified with sub-pixel resolution.
       The origin at the TLHC of the TLHC pixel is 0.0\0.0, the BRHC of the TLHC pixel is 1.0\1.0, and the BRHC of the BRHC pixel is the number of columns\rows in the image / frames. The values must be within the range 0\0 to the number of columns\rows in the image / frames.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: A selection of DICOM SOP instances and/or frames
element.definition: A selection of DICOM SOP instances and/or frames within a single Study and Series. This might include additional specifics such as an image region, an Observation UID or a Segmentation Number, allowing linkage to an Observation Resource or transferring this information along with the ImagingStudy Resource.
The current state of the ImagingSelection resource. This is not the status of any ImagingStudy, ServiceRequest, or Task resources associated with the ImagingSelection.
element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

element.definition: The current state of the ImagingSelection resource. This is not the status of any ImagingStudy, ServiceRequest, or Task resources associated with the ImagingSelection.

element.definition: The date and time this imaging selection was created.

element.short: The Frame of Reference UID for the selected images
element.definition: The Frame of Reference UID identifying the coordinate system that conveys spatial and/or temporal information for the selected images or frames.

element.short: Data type name for ImagingSelection.bodySite from FHIR R5
element.definition: Data type name for ImagingSelection.bodySite from FHIR R5

element.comment: Must be: CodeableReference

element.definition: A reference to a concept - e.g. the information is identified by its general class to the degree of precision found in the terminology.
A reference to a concept - e.g. the information is identified by its general class to the degree of precision found in the terminology.
A reference to a resource the provides exact details about the information being referenced.
A reference to a resource the provides exact details about the information being referenced.

element.short: Related resource that is the focus for the imaging selection
element.definition: The actual focus of an observation when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. For example, fetus observations in a mother's record.  The focus of an observation could also be an existing condition,  an intervention, the subject's diet,  another observation of the subject,  or a body structure such as tumor or implanted device.   An example use case would be using the Observation resource to capture whether the mother is trained to change her child's tracheostomy tube. In this example, the child is the patient of record and the mother is the focus.

element.short: Related resource that is the focus for the imaging selection
element.definition: The actual focus of an observation when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. For example, fetus observations in a mother's record.  The focus of an observation could also be an existing condition,  an intervention, the subject's diet,  another observation of the subject,  or a body structure such as tumor or implanted device.   An example use case would be using the Observation resource to capture whether the mother is trained to change her child's tracheostomy tube. In this example, the child is the patient of record and the mother is the focus.
Each imaging selection includes one or more selected DICOM SOP instances.
The SOP Instance UID for the selected DICOM instance.

element.short: The selected subset of the SOP Instance
element.definition:
Selected subset of the SOP Instance. The content and format of the subset item is determined by the SOP Class of the selected instance.
       May be one of:
       - A list of frame numbers selected from a multiframe SOP Instance.
       - A list of Content Item Observation UID values selected from a DICOM SR or other structured document SOP Instance.
       - A list of segment numbers selected from a segmentation SOP Instance.
       - A list of Region of Interest (ROI) numbers selected from a radiotherapy structure set SOP Instance.

element.short: The selected subset of the SOP Instance
element.definition:
Selected subset of the SOP Instance. The content and format of the subset item is determined by the SOP Class of the selected instance.
       May be one of:
       - A list of frame numbers selected from a multiframe SOP Instance.
       - A list of Content Item Observation UID values selected from a DICOM SR or other structured document SOP Instance.
       - A list of segment numbers selected from a segmentation SOP Instance.
       - A list of Region of Interest (ROI) numbers selected from a radiotherapy structure set SOP Instance.

element.short: A specific 2D region in a DICOM image / frame
element.definition:
Each imaging selection instance or frame list might includes an image region, specified by a region type and a set of 2D coordinates.
       If the parent imagingSelection.instance contains a subset element of type frame, the image region applies to all frames in the subset list.
Specifies the type of image region.
Specifies the type of image region.

element.short: Specifies the coordinates that define the image region
element.definition:
The coordinates describing the image region. Encoded as a set of (column, row) pairs that denote positions in the selected image / frames specified with sub-pixel resolution.
       The origin at the TLHC of the TLHC pixel is 0.0\0.0, the BRHC of the TLHC pixel is 1.0\1.0, and the BRHC of the BRHC pixel is the number of columns\rows in the image / frames. The values must be within the range 0\0 to the number of columns\rows in the image / frames.

element.short: Specifies the coordinates that define the image region
element.definition:
The coordinates describing the image region. Encoded as a set of (column, row) pairs that denote positions in the selected image / frames specified with sub-pixel resolution.
       The origin at the TLHC of the TLHC pixel is 0.0\0.0, the BRHC of the TLHC pixel is 1.0\1.0, and the BRHC of the BRHC pixel is the number of columns\rows in the image / frames. The values must be within the range 0\0 to the number of columns\rows in the image / frames.

element.short: A specific 3D region in a DICOM frame of reference
element.definition: Each imaging selection might includes a 3D image region, specified by a region type and a set of 3D coordinates.

element.short: point | multipoint | polyline | polygon | ellipse | ellipsoid
element.definition: Specifies the type of image region.

element.short: point | multipoint | polyline | polygon | ellipse | ellipsoid
element.definition: Specifies the type of image region.

element.short: Specifies the coordinates that define the image region
element.definition: The coordinates describing the image region. Encoded as an ordered set of (x,y,z) triplets (in mm and may be negative) that define a region of interest in the patient-relative Reference Coordinate System defined by ImagingSelection.frameOfReferenceUid element.

element.short: Specifies the coordinates that define the image region
element.definition: The coordinates describing the image region. Encoded as an ordered set of (x,y,z) triplets (in mm and may be negative) that define a region of interest in the patient-relative Reference Coordinate System defined by ImagingSelection.frameOfReferenceUid element.
